I can find them sometimes when I'm walking along
the beach.

column3:
時間があるなら浜辺にいってみたら？
いい気分転換になるわよ
column4:
If you have time, why don't you go to the beach?
It's a nice change of pace.

column3: 外にいたら髪がべたべたになっちゃう
column4: My hair gets sticky when I'm outside.

column3:
ご機嫌いかが？
ゆっくりしていってよね
column4:
How are you?
Take your time.

column3:
あっ、覚者さん！
そういえば良いニュースがあるんだ
column4:
Ah, Ser Arisen!
By the way, I have good news.

column3:
ブリアにある《辺境の礎》ってやつが
全部使えるようになったらしいよ！
column4:
I heard that the sub-crystal in Breya is now
available at
all of them!

column3:
俺はアレの使い方、いまいちわかってないんだけど
何でも、覚者さんが今までに触ったことのない礎も
このブリア内にある分は全部使えるんだってさ
column4:
I'm not quite sure how I'm supposed to use that
thing, but whatever.
Even the Keystones that the Arisen has never
touched before,he can use all of the ones in Breya.

column3:
覚者さんがよくブリアに来るからって
神殿の人たちが手配してくれたんだ
今まで行きにくかった場所にも
一瞬で行けるんだってね
column4:
The people at Temple arranged it because Arisen
often come to Breya.
They said he can go to places that have been hard
to get to in an instant.

column3:
探索しやすくなったブリアを
そしてローテスを、これからもよろしく！
column4:
Keep up the good work with Breya
and Rotes, which is now easier to explore!

column3:
そうそう、覚者さんにお願いしたいことがあってさ
ルドルフォ爺さんの家の近くに古い井戸があるだろ
その奥に光るものを見たって人がいるんだ
column4:
Oh yeah, I've got a request for you, Arisen.
You know that old well near Grandpa Rudolfo's
house.
Some people say they saw something shiny at the
back of it.

column3:
もしかして、もしかしたらだよ
井戸の底にお宝が眠ってたりしたら――！
お宝って意外とああいう地味なところに
ありそうだしさ！
column4:
Maybe, just maybe
there is a treasure at the bottom of the well..!
Treasure can be found in such a humble place

column3:
ってわけで、よかったら中を見てきて欲しいんだ
行く前には一声かけてくれ
井戸底に沈む青い光、気になるじゃないか
column4:
So, I'd like you to come take a look inside if
you'd like.
Give me a shout before you go.
The blue light at the bottom of the well, it's
curious, isn't it?

column3:
覚者さん、この前も見てきてもらった
《灯台下の古井戸》なんだけどさ
奥に封鎖された扉があっただろ？

あれは古い遺跡に繋がる扉らしいんだけど
俺がエリアマスターになった時には
既に封鎖されててね
奥がどうなってるかは誰も知らないんだ
column4:
That's supposed to be a door that leads to an old
ruin
but by the time I became Area Master
it was already sealed up
and no one knows what's going on in the back.

column3:
でも、ずっと封鎖したままっていうのもなんだし
今は覚者さんもよく寄ってくれるから
思い切って封鎖を解いてみたんだ
column4:
But I didn't want to keep the blockade up
forever, so
I took the plunge and unblocked it,
since I've had a lot of Arisen people stop by now.

column3:
海は男のロマンだけど
封鎖されていた遺跡っていうのも
何というかくすぐられるものがあるだろ？
column4:
The ocean is a man's romance, but
there's something tantalizing about a site that's
been sealed off, too
isn't there?

column3: 覚者さん、ちょっと内密に話が――
column4: Arisen, let's talk in secret for a moment...

column3:
い、いや、隠さなきゃいけないような
話じゃないんだけどさ
この前封鎖を解いた《モルトバ遺跡》――
出る、らしくって――
column4:
No, no, I'm not talking about the kind of
story that needs to be hidden.
The Moltova Ruins, which we broke the blockade on
the other day--
I'm going to go out there, and it seems--

column3:
何が出るって、そりゃもちろんアレだよ！
竜だよ！　水竜ってやつさ
column4:
What's coming out, of course, is that thing!
A dragon!　A water dragon.

column3:
覚者さんが居るからと思って
封鎖は解いたけど
中の竜に暴れられるのは困るんだ
column4:
I thought because the Arisen is here I've broken
the blockade, but
I don't want the dragon inside to get out of
control.

column3:
外に出てくる気配が無いか見てきてもらえないかな
出発前に声かけてくれると助かるよ
column4:
Could you go see if there's any sign of them
coming outside
I'd appreciate it if you'd give me a shout before
you leave.

column3:
覚者さんがブリアに寄ってくれるようになって
本当に助かってるんだ
いつもありがとう！
column4:
Arisen, thank you so much for coming to Breya
I really appreciate it
Thank you always!

column3:
俺も少しは覚者さんの力になりたいからさ
今まで以上に良いものを渡せるように頑張るよ
column4:
I also want to be of help to you, Arisen
I'll do my best to give you even better things
than before

column3:
今や覚者さんあってのブリアだからさ！
今後ともよろしく頼むよ！
column4:
Now it's thanks to you, Arisen, that there is
Breya!
I'll rely on you from now on too!

column3:
覚者さん、《クエストボード》見てくれよ！
手伝ってもらえたらローテスも大助かりさ
column4:
Arisen, please check the "quest board"!
If you can help, it will be a great help to Rotes
too

column3: 岬のモルトバ灯台へはもう行ったか？
column4:
Have you already been to Moltova Lighthouse on
the cape?

column3:
ルドルフォの爺さんに会ったら
よろしく伝えといてくれ
column4:
If you see old Rudolfo, tell him I said
hello.

column3:
海のロマンはやっぱでっかさだろ！
たまに来る漂流船なんか最高さ！
column4:
The romance of the sea is the size of it!
The occasional drifting ship is the best!

column3:
でも、どっから来るんだろうな
神殿の洋撃船でもなさそうだが
column4:
But I wonder where it's coming from.
It doesn't look like it's the Temple's Western
blasting ship.

column3:
――もう、何ていうかさ
あんたがローテスに来てくれて
本当に良かったよ
column4:
-You know, I was really glad when you came to
Rotes.

column3:
今まで騎士団も神殿も、ここまで
親身になってくれた人はいなかったしな
俺も、できる限りあんたの力になるよ
column4:
No one has ever been so
kind to me before, not the Knights or the Temple,
and
I'll help you as much as I can, too.

column3:
こんにちは、あらためて自己紹介ね
俺はこの一帯、ブリア海岸の
エリアマスターをやってるオニールだ
column4:
Hi, I'd like to introduce myself again.
I'm O'Neill, the
area master for this part of the Breya Coast.

column3:
自慢の海と砂浜は見てくれたかい？
ちょっとばかりのんびりした気分に
なってしまうけど、見た目よりずっと危険だよ
column4:
Have you seen our boastful ocean and sandy
beaches?
It makes you feel a little more relaxed
but it's a lot more dangerous than it looks!

column3:
海の影響だろうけど魔物もハイデルや
ミスリウとは違うから気をつけてくれ
column4:
I know it's probably the influence of the ocean,
but be careful, the demons aren't the same as
Heidel or
Mysree.

column3:
あとは――目下の問題と言えば
海賊まがいのならず者《ブリア宝奪団》だな
今はそれが一番の悩みの種だね
column4:
The other thing - the problem at hand is
the pirate-like ruffians, the Breya Treasure
Robbers.
That's the biggest problem we have right now.

column3:
まあ、わからないことがあったら
とりあえず聞いてくれよ
column4:
Well, if there's something you don't understand,
please ask me
for now

column3:
いやー、さすが覚者さん！
何かと任せちゃって申し訳ない
これからもよろしくな
column4:
Wow, you're truly an Arisen!
I'm sorry for relying on you so much
From now on, please take care of me as well

column3:
やぁ、ありがとう
また仕事手伝ってくれよな
column4:
Hey, thank you
Please help me with my work again

column3: 来てくれたら支援品をあげるからさ！
column4: I'll give you support items if you come

column3:
やぁ、ありがとう
また仕事、手伝ってくれよな
column4:
Hey, thank you
Please help me with my work again

column3:
あ、覚者さん聞いてくれよ
村のすぐ裏にある《隠れ浜》なんだけどさ
column4:
Oh, Arisen, listen to me:
There's a "Hidden Beach" right behind the village.

column3:
特に最近、そこにガラの悪そうなのが
ちょいちょい出入りしてるみたいなんだよ
例の《ブリア宝奪団》の奴らかなぁ
column4:
Especially lately, there seems to be a lot of bad
guys
going in and out of there every now and then.
I wonder if they're from the Breya Treasure Troop.

column3: とにかく、怪しいのがいたら何とかしてくれよ
column4:
Anyway, if you see something suspicious, please
take care of it.

column3:
お、そうだ！
あんたに渡すものがあったんだ
column4:
Oh, yeah!
I had something for you.

column3:
見てくれ、今日は結構良い物があってさ
持ってってくれよ！
column4:
Look, I've got some pretty good stuff today.
Take it!

column3:
覚者さん、海岸を少し行ったところに
廃墟があるんだけどさ
そこに地下倉庫があるのを知ってるか？
column4:
Arisen, there's an abandoned house little ways
down the coast.
Did you know there's an underground warehouse
there?

column3:
村のみんなが《海辺の地下室》って
呼んでる場所だよ
危ないから封鎖してたんだけど
column4:
The villagers all call that place
the "Seaside Cellar".
It was sealed off because of the danger though.

column3:
その中から、話し声が聞こえてさ
どうも誰かが入り込んでるみたいなんだ
中を見ようと思ったけど勇気が無くて――
column4:
I heard voices coming from within.
It seems that someone is inside.
I wanted to look in, but I didn't have the
courage--

column3:
もし通りかかったら見てみてくれよ
今度こそ《ブリア宝奪団》かもしれないな
column4:
If you're passing by, take a look.
It may be the "Breya Treasure Bandits" this time.

column3:
顔出してくれてありがとうな
そうだ、これ使ってくれよ
何かの足しにはなるだろ
column4:
Thank you for showing up.
Oh yes, please use this.
It may be of some help.

column3:
覚者さん、ちょっと相談乗ってくれよ
ハーピーの営巣地、知ってるか？
ほら、《鳥寄せ岩》
column4:
Arisen, a little advice for you.
Do you know where the harpies are nesting?
You know, the birdbath rock.

column3:
あそこに、卵を抱えた親ハーピーが
群がるようになってさ
《マーテル・ハーピー》って言って、普通の
ハーピーより凶暴なんだよ
column4:
There, the parent harpies with their eggs
started swarming
and they are called "Martell Harpies" and they
are more ferocious than the normal
harpies.

column3:
このままだとルドルフォの爺さんに
配達にいくのも大変だ
手が空いたらでいいから、退治頼めないかい？
column4:
If this keeps up, it's going to be hard to get
old Rudolfo to
deliver the goods.
When you get around to it, can you ask him to
exterminate them for you?

column3:
丁度いいとこにきたな
これ、余りものだけど持ってってくれ
column4:
You've come to the right place.
Here, take this, it's a leftover.

column3:
いやー、さすが覚者さん！
何かと任せちゃって申し訳ない
column4:
Lord, you're amazing!
I'm sorry to keep asking you for things

column3:
もっと良い物渡せるように頑張るからさ
これからもよろしくな
column4:
I'll do my best to get you better items, so
please continue to take care of me

column3: ああ、覚者さん良い所に！
column4: Ah, you're in a good place, Arisen!

column3:
南の浜辺――《青爪浜》には行った事が
あるかい？
column4:
Have you ever been to the southern shore, Blue
Claw Beach?

column3:
そこへ行く途中のキャンプ跡に
いつの間にかホブゴブリンが居付いちゃった
ようなんだ
体格も大きいし、村の方に来たら大変だ！
column4:
On the way there, we came across the remains of a
camp
and before we knew it, a hobgoblin had settled
there.
It's a big guy.
He's big, and if he comes towards the village,
it's going to be a big problem!

column3:
もし見かけたら退治してくれよ
騎士団にも連絡したんだけど、なかなか
返事が来なくてさ
column4:
If you see him, please exterminate him.
I've contacted the Knights of Columbus, but they
haven't gotten back to me
.

column3: そうだ覚者さん、ビッグニュースだよ！
column4: Hey, Arisen! I have big news!

column3:
例の財宝なんだけど
ありそうな場所が分かったんだ！
column4:
I found the treasure
and I think I know where it might be!

column3:
結論から言うと、それは
ルフロー近くにある《潮騒洞窟》――
column4:
As it turns out, it's
the 《Tidal Caverns Cave》 near LeFlore--

column3:
なぁ、興味あるよな？
探しにってみないかい？
column4:
Hey, you're interested, right?
Would you like to come and look for it?

column3:
ずっと封鎖されてたんだけど
今は入れるようにしておいたから
行くってなったら俺に話しかけてくれよ
財宝について詳しく話すからさ
column4:
It was sealed for a long time,
but I've opened it for you now.
Let me know if you decide to go and
I'll tell you more about the treasure.

column3:
か、覚者さん――
ちょっと聞いてほしいことが
あ、あるんだけどさ――
column4:
Ah, Arisen--
There's something I'd like to,
ah, speak with you about--

column3:
――え！？
いや、俺は特になにも――
っていうか全然怖がってないけど！
column4:
--What?
No, I'm not particularly scared of anything--
I mean, I'm not scared at all!

column3:
とにかく聞いてくれよ
ほら、南の浜辺に廃村があるって話は
前にしただろ？
column4:
Anyway, listen,
see, I told you before
that there's an abandoned village on the southern
beach, right?

column3:
ルフローっていうだいぶ前に滅んだ村さ
行ったことはあるかい？
column4:
There's a long-defunct village called Leflor.
Have you ever been there?

column3:
一夜で滅んだことだけははっきりしてるけど
大波が来たのか、魔物にやられたのか
本当のところは謎なんだ
財宝の件もまだ分からないんだけどさ
column4:
The only thing that's clear is that it was
destroyed overnight.
Was it a big wave or did the demons get it?
The real story is a mystery.
We still don't know what happened to the
treasure, either.

column3:
で、そのルフロー付近で、何か呟きながら
彷徨う人影を見たって
昨日宿に寄った旅人が言ってたんだよ――
column4:
So, near that Leflor, a traveler who stopped by
the inn yesterday
said he saw a figure wandering
around, muttering something--.

column3:
――これって、もしかして幽霊――？
ほら覚者さんも気になるだろ？
だからさ、ほら。確かめてきてくれよ
column4:
-Is this, perhaps, a ghost...?
Hey, Arisen, I'm sure you're curious too, right?
So, come on. Please go and check it out.

column3:
――もう、何ていうかさ
あんたがローテスに来てくれて
本当に良かったよ
column4:
-You know, I was really glad when you came to
Rotes.

column3:
今まで騎士団も神殿も、ここまで
親身になってくれた人はいなかったし
俺も、できる限りあんたを支援するよ
column4:
No Knighthood or Temple has ever been so
accommodating, and
I'll support you as much as I can, too.

column3: これからも、よろしくな！
column4: From now on, count on me!

column3:
大変だ、覚者さん！
《青爪浜》にすごく強そうなサイクロプスが
現れたらしいんだ
column4:
Oh my God, Arisen!
A very powerful Cyclops has appeared on the Blue
Claw Beach.

column3:
もしかしたら、そいつがルフローを
一夜で壊滅させた魔物なのかなぁ！？
column4:
Maybe that's the demon that destroyed LeFlore
in one night!

column3:
もしそんなのがローテスへ来るような
ことがあったら――
column4:
If such a thing
were to come to Rotes--

column3:
頼むよ、大変だとは思うけど
なんとかできるとしたら、覚者さんくらいしか
思いつかないんだ
そいつをどうにか撃退してくれよ！
column4:
Please, I know it's a lot to ask, but the only
person I can think of who can do something about
it is the Arisen!
I can't think of anything else.
You've got to fight that guy off somehow!

column3:
よう！　ブリア海岸近辺の事なら
何でも聞いてくれ
column4:
Yo!　If you're in the vicinity of the Breya Coast,
, ask me anything you want.

column3:
そ、そうだ！
灯台の方にいくなら、《鳥寄せ岩》の
近くは気を付けたほうがいいよ
column4:
Oh, yeah!
If you're going towards the lighthouse, you
should be careful near the "Birdcage Rock"

column3:
気が立った親ハーピーが巣を作ってて
通りかかった人が襲われることも
あるらしいんだ
column4:
I've heard that sometimes the crazed parent
harpies build nests
and attack passersby
.

column3:
し、心配だ！
海から化け物がきたらどうしよう！
column4:
I'm worried!
What if a monster comes from the sea?

column3:
ううーん、裏の浜辺から何かの
唸り声が聞こえる気がする――
column4:
Ummm, I think I hear something
roaring from the beach out back--

column3:
見晴らしが良くても敵に見つかり
そうだし、悪くても何か潜んでそうだ
ど、どうしたら！
column4:
If the view is good, the enemy will find it
likely, and if it's bad, something will be lurking
which, what to do!

column3: あ、ああ、僕に何か用？
column4: Ah, ah, do you need something from me?

column3: 今日の晩ご飯のお魚なにかな
column4:
I wonder what fish we're having for dinner
tonight.

column3:
海沿い歩くの大好き！
水が気持ちいいよね
column4:
I love walking by the sea!
The water feels so good

column3:
知ってる？　崖の上の灯台
かなり昔からあるんだって
column4:
Do you know? The lighthouse on top of the cliff
has been there for a long time

column3: こんにちは！
column4: Hello!

column3:
あら、冒険者の方？
もし良ければなのですが、奥にいるアニスに
外の話を聞かせてやってくれません？
column4:
Oh, are you an adventurer?
If you don't mind, could you go inside and tell
Anise
the news from outside?

column3:
アニス――
私の子は足が不自由で
可哀そうな想いをさせてしまっているんです
column4:
Anise--
my boy is crippled
and I feel sorry for him.

column3:
冒険者さん、あなた方は色々な所へ
旅されているんでしょうね
column4: Adventurers, I know you guys travel a lot

column3:
あら、こんにちは
わざわざ来て下さってありがとう
column4:
Oh, hello
Thanks for coming all the way out here!

column3:
まったく、そこの《隠れ浜》は厄介だ
追い払っても追い払っても、不逞の輩が
たむろして――
column4:
Indeed, the "hidden beach" there is a nuisance.
No matter whether you drive them away or not, the
tramps
hang around and--

column3:
せっかく捕った魚を奪われては
たまらんよ
column4:
I can't
let them take all the fish we've caught.

column3:
浜のあたりにハーピーが増えて
船小屋まで行きにくくなってしまった
まったく迷惑なやつらだよ
column4:
More harpies around the beach
and it's harder to get to the boathouse
They're totally annoying!

column3:
ヒュージブルが居なかった時は、もっと沖まで
船が出せたというし、深い海でも泳げたそうだ
column4:
They say that when Huge Bull wasn't around, they
could
sail farther out to sea and swim in deeper water!

column3:
が、そんな昔のことを知っとる奴は
もうおらんな
column4:
But who knows about those old days
any more?

column3:
漁はほそぼそと続けとるよ
ヒュージブルだの海竜だの、物騒に
なってきたがね
column4:
Fishing is still going on slowly.
Fugeables and sea dragons are getting noisy.

column3:
食う分の魚はまだ獲れるなぁ
生活には困っとらんよ
column4:
I can still catch enough fish to eat.
I don't have to make a living.

column3:
たまに大きな船が浜に流れ着く
あれは、帰ってこれなかった
神殿の船なのかね？
column4:
Sometimes big boats wash up on the beach
That one didn't make it back
Is it a temple boat?

column3: ん？　何だね
column4: Hm? What's up?

column3:
ローテスは漁村ですが
海にはヒュージブルがいるため
あまり住民は沖へでませんね
column4:
Rotes is a fishing village, but
the residents don't go offshore much because of
the fusibles in the sea

column3: 浅い所は大丈夫でありますが

調査の際は十分に注意しておくことだ

If you're interested, it may be good to
investigate inside.

inside.
Be cautious during the investigation.

column3:
――口うるさいと思わないでくれ
このテルの守り手を失いたくはないのだ
column4:
Please don't think I'm being annoying.

column3:
ああ、よいところに来てくれた

Ah, you've come at a good time.
I actually have something I want to discuss with
you.

以前調査してきてもらった《アーク》の付近から

column4:
From the vicinity of the 《Ark》 that you have
previously surveyed for me
, insects and small animals have been
disappearing lately.

アークに変化が起こっているのかも知れん
そこで、貴君に内部を

column4:
There may be a change in the arc
so I need you to go inside
and check it out, can you do that for me?

column3:
引き受けてくれるようであれば、

貴君に詳しく伝えよう
column4:
If you are willing to accept,
please talk to me again
I've been looking around ARC and found out some
things
I'll tell you more about it.

column3:
貴君の働きにはわたしも、テルの村人たちも

column4:
I and the villagers of Tell are very grateful to
you for your work

column3:
今回、村人たちからの強い希望もあって

column4:
This time, due to strong requests from the
villagers,
we have decided to have an even better selection
of support items.

column3:
貴君への恩に報いるには足りぬが、

column4:
It is not enough to repay your debt to me, but
please accept it as a gesture from all of us in
the
village.

column3:
これからも、よろしく頼む
テルとハイデルの守り手であってくれ
column4:
Please keep up the good work.
Be a defender of Tell and Heidel.

column3:
貴君がレオの信頼を得ているならば、

If you have Leo's trust,
or if you let your curiosity get the better of
you--

それだけ多く、様々な地を

So many, many places
will be visited
and many will be waiting to see you in action!

白竜が衰えたことで

With the decline of the white dragon,
Lestania has been attacked by various mutations
and
demons for the past 300 years.

with.

新しい土地へ行ったら

column4:

don't forget to say hello to the Area Master

我々を大いに活用しつつ各地の問題を解決してくれ

problems in various places

column4:
You already have our gratitude

I will provide a way to the villages of Pawn
Cathedral and Lynwood

テルのすぐ西にある洞窟、《狩人の抜け穴》

demons for the last 300 years!

すでに知っているかもしれないが

Tell has been suffering from a mysterious plague
for some time now

疫病の原因調査は、これまでに多くの

The investigation of the cause of the epidemic

Well, you see, something troublesome has
happened. It seems that a troublesome goblin has
returned to the bridge commonly known as the
"Roaring Demon Bridge" to the east of Tel.

ヤツは《橋守のビンシャ》と名乗り

themselves

them?

ヤツは返り討ちにした騎士や覚者から

It seems that he has taken several
"high-grade equipment" from the knights and the
Arisen he has defeated.

column3:

If you can subdue him, you will also be able to
retrieve it
and get it back.
Please keep that in mind.

column3:
村を代表して礼を言う
貴君はテルにとって英雄だ
column4:
I will express my gratitude on behalf of the
village.
You are a hero to Tel.

column3:
これからもどうかよろしく頼む
わたしも貴君のために、できることを探してみよう
column4:
I have an idea,
please continue to rely on me, I will try to find
what I can do for you

リンウッドから木材が届いてな

The South Heidel Bridge, which had been damaged
by the flood, was finally restored.
Lumber arrived from Lynwood.

これで、例の抜け穴を通らずとも
テルからミスリウ森林方面に
行きやすくなったぞ
column4:
Now it's easier to get to
from the
tell to the Misliu Forest without having to go
through the loophole in the example!

column3:
おお、来てくれたか！

column4:

Deep"

霊廟の地下二階より下は
先代のエリアマスターが

Below the second basement floor of the mausoleum
the previous area master
had it sealed off early on!

column3:
あの《開かずの路》で発見した手帳に
そのくだりと、霊廟深部の封鎖を解除する
スペリングが書かれていた
column4:
The notebook I found in that "open road"
had that crap and the
spelling to break the blockade deep in the
mausoleum.

column3:
今なら、《ハイデル地下霊廟　深部》へ

column4:

Catacombs Depths"
.

column3:
もし調査の続きを頼めるなら
あらためて、わたしに話しかけてくれ
column4:
If you want to continue the investigation
please talk to me again.

column3:
いつもすまないな
お陰で本当に助かっている
心ばかりだが、礼をさせてくれ
column4:

You've been a real help
Let me thank you from the bottom of my heart.

――I think it's about time I inform you about that
matter.
About Menvili, the man who was a priest at the
infamous Heidell Church.

column3:
もう数十年前のことだが、司祭は
村人から邪教崇拝の疑いをかけられて
追われ、失踪した
column4:
Decades ago, the priest was
suspected by the villagers of pagan worship,
chased and disappeared.

司祭の家の地下室から、多数の死体と
怪しい祭壇が発見されたからだ
column4:
Because a number of dead bodies and a
suspicious altar were found in the basement of a
priest's house.

column3:
――貴君も心当たりがあるだろう？
前に貴君が魔物退治をしたあの廃屋――
あそここそ、司祭メンヴィルの住居なのだ
column4:
Perhaps you have an idea as well?
That abandoned house where you exterminated the
monsters earlier--
That place is none other than the residence of
Priest Menvili.

以来、地下室から続く祭壇への通路は

先代のエリアマスターから受け継いだ
column4:

from the basement is called
"The Open Road" and is a place that should be
sealed
inherited from the previous area master.

わたしも中を調べるつもりだが
貴君も興味があれば行ってみてくれ
column4:
I'm going to check inside too
if you're interested.

column3:
司祭、霊廟、そしてこの《開かずの路》――
疫病と何か関係がある気がしてならない
column4:
Priests, mausoleums, and this "open road" -
I can't help but think it has something to do
with the plague.

column3:
貴君には手伝ってもらってばかりだな
良ければまた手を貸してくれ
column4:
You've been helping me a lot.
I'd like to give you a hand again, if you don't
mind.

column3:
貴君、《血すすぎ河原》のことは知っているか？
あの場所に、ひときわ体の大きなリザードマンが
棲みつくようになったのだ
column4:
Have you ever heard of the "Blood Soak Riverbed"?
A very large lizardman
has come to inhabit that place!

河原はテルとも近い
かの大トカゲが村人や家畜を襲う前に
退治してくれないだろうか
column4:
The riverbank is also close to Tel
before that giant lizard attacks villagers and
livestock

column3:
――貴君、そういえば例の《開かずの路》へは
行ってみたか？
column4:
By the way, have you tried going to that 'Blocked
Passage' we mentioned before, my lord?

column3:
村の枯れ井戸と繋がっていたとは――

ぞっとする話だ
column4:
I didn't realize it was connected to the
village's dry well--
I'd be horrified if it hadn't

たまに何やら臭うのも
おそらくそのせいだったのだな――
column4:

column3:
わたしもあの場所を調べ、手掛かりらしき

column4:
I also checked that place and found a clue
that looks like my predecessor's notebook
I'll pass it on to you when I've done some more
research.

ああ、そう言えば！
渡したいものがあるのだ
column4:
Oh, by the way!
I have something for you.

column3:
貴君のためにこれを取っておいた
どうか、旅に役立ててくれ
column4:
I have kept this for you,
please make use of it on your journey

貴君、ハイデルで最も危険な場所は
どこか知っているか？

Do you know the most dangerous place in Heidel,
?

それは、東にある教会の地下墓地
《ハイデル地下霊廟》だ
column4:
It is the underground cemetery of the church in
the east,
called "Hidell Catacombs"

column3:
調査に向かった覚者もほとんど戻らず
さまよい出る亡者も増えたので、
ここしばらく封鎖していたんだが――
column4:
Few of the Arisen who went to
investigate have returned
and more of the departed have wandered off, so
we've been on lockdown for a while now--and we're
still here.

column3:
貴君ならあの場所を調べることが

《ハイデル地下霊廟》を開放しよう
column4:
You might be able to check out that place
and open up the "Heidel Underground Mausoleum"!

column3:
どうするかは委ねるが
行くなら頼みたいことがある
その気があれば、あらためて話しかけてくれ
column4:
I'll leave it to you to decide what to do, but
If you go, there's something I'd like to ask of
you.
Please speak with me again if so.

column3:
おお、貴君か
良い物資が手に入ったのだ
これを持って行ってくれ
column4:
Oh, it's you.
I've managed to get some good supplies.
Please take this with you.

column3:
テルとハイデルのため力を尽くしてくれた
貴君に、わたしもできることを探してみたのだ
column4:
I wanted to do something for you
in return for all you have done for Tel and
Heidell.

column3:
現状手に入る最も良い支援品を
手配しておいた
貴君の恩に報いるには、とうてい足りていないがな
column4:
I've arranged for the best support goods we can
currently get.
Though, I fear it is still far from enough to
repay your kindness.

column3:
これからも、よろしく頼む
テルとハイデルの守り手であってくれ
column4:
Please keep up the good work.
Be a defender of Tell and Heidel.

column3:
よく来たな
今回の支援品だ、受け取ってくれ
column4:
You've made it!
Here are the support goods. Please take them.

column3:
貴君、ハイデルの街道に野盗が度々
出ることは知っているだろう？
column4:
You know, my dear, that the streets of Heidel are
often
riddled with wild thieves, don't you?

ヤツらの名は《黒狼団》
東のアジトに居を構える盗賊集団だ
column4:
Their name is the Black Wolf Bandit Group
, a bandit group that has its hideout in the east.

神殿から指名手配され姿を消していた
その首領ラダンが、どうやらアジトに
戻ってきたらしい
column4:
The leader, Ladan, who was wanted by the Temple
and disappeared
, has apparently returned
to his hideout!

column3:
連中は、高価なアクセサリーや宝飾品を

column4:
It is said that they have stolen a considerable
amount of expensive accessories and jewelry
.

column3:
今や覚者隊でも騎士団でもなく、貴君が頼りだ

column4:
Now it's not the Sentinel Corps or the Knights,
it's you.
Keep an eye out for them.

やあ、貴君は――

Hey, you--
took care of me during the Gardolyn debacle.

ところで、あの一件の裏側を

side of that one
?

病に倒れた母親をかかえ

There's a young girl struggling
with an ailing mother...

Galdrin heard about it and came up with the idea
of
gambling over demon slaying.

親子はキノザの温泉で湯治をすると

The father and son took a hot spring bath in

tell him I was impressed.

エリアマスターとはこれでなかなか

no easy task, I tell you—

column3:

column4:
However, I am very proud to think that I am
contributing to the Temple and the White

column3: せいぜい、活用してやってくれ

column3:
貴君の活躍は
見事なものだったと聞いているぞ
column4:
I hear that your performance was
brilliant.

column3:
各地のエリアマスターも喜んでいることだろう

ごくろうだった

Each Area Master in each area will be delighted,
and of course, so am I
Thank you for your hard work

, right?

Lynwood is the best!

!

column3: いい坑道はあちこちにあるんですけどねえ
column4: There are good mines everywhere, but...

column3:
どうも覚者さん
あたしにご用で？
column4:
Hi, Arisen.
You wanted to see me?

column3:
ふー、遠出したいけど勇気がでなくて――
強い護衛を雇うしかないかなぁ
column4:
Whew, I want to go away, but I'm not brave
enough--
I guess I'll just have to hire a strong escort.

column3:
ゴツゴツした岩みたいな鬼やらトカゲやら
外にはうようよ居るっていうじゃないか
あわわわ
column4:
There are rough-looking demons or lizards or
something like that,
and they say that there are a lot of them outside.
Ahh...

column3:
よ、よしリンウッドまで行くぞ！
そ、そのうちに――
column4:
Alright, let's go to Lynwood!
And, eventually--

column3: や、やぁ、何か用？
column4: Um, um, do you need something?

column3:
そ、そういえばさ
キノザからちょっと山の麓へ下りて
北に行ったところに《ボルド小坑道》って
場所があるのは知ってるかい？
column4:
Oh, by the way,
did you know that there is a place called "Volden
Narrow Tunnels"
north of Kinoza, a little down the foot of the
mountain?

column3:
そこはかなり前から怖いオーガがうろつく
ようになったんたけど、派遣された騎士団が
かなりやられちゃったらしいんだ！
column4:
There has been a scary ogre roaming
around there for quite a while now, but the
knights who were sent there
got hit pretty hard, I heard!

column3:
戦いの跡がまだ残ってて、《山腹の野戦場》
なんて呼ばれているよ
ううう、おそろしい――！
column4:
There are still battle scars and it's called
《Fieldsides of the Mountainside》
Ugh, horrifying--!

column3:
ふう、貴重な宝石の原石を探しに
ここへ来たのだけれど、魔物が邪魔で
なかなか思うように探せないわ
column4:
I came here
to look for precious gemstones, but the demons
are in the way
and I can't find them as easily as I'd like.

column3:
ねぇあなた、《ボルド大坑道》へは行った？
閉鎖されてから、中はどうなっているのかしら
column4:
Hey, have you been to the Bordo Tunnel?
I wonder what's going on in there since it was
closed.

column3:
巨人出現って、サイクロプスかコロッサス
でも出たのかしら
column4:
Giants appeared, were there also Cyclops or
Colossus
?

column3:
魔物の中には、宝石を身体に生やした
ステキな生き物もいるそうなの
column4:
It seems that among the enemies there are also
creatures with gems growing on their bodies like

column3:
まるで宝石そのもの、みたいな魔物も
いるらしいわ
column4:
They say there are monsters that look just like
real gems.

column3: なんとか生け捕りにできないかしら
column4: I wonder if they can be captured alive somehow

column3: その様子、あなたも探索者かしら？
column4: Are you also an adventurer exploring this place?

column3:
ここは《癒しの泉》です
ゆっくり旅のお疲れを癒してくださいね
column4:
This is the "Spring of Healing"
Please relax and heal your fatigue from your
journey

column3:
浴場では、ミックスハーブの蒸気も
炊いているんですよ
column4:
In the bath, we are also steaming
mixed herbs

column3: ごゆっくり
column4: Enjoy your stay

column3: 《癒しの泉》のお湯はいかがですか？
column4:
How about the hot spring water at the "Spring of
Healing"?

column3:
ふー、いいお湯！
のぼせないようにしないとねぇ
column4:
Whew, nice hot water!
I'll have to try not to get bloated!

column3:
あんた、異国の覚者なんだろ！？
あのタラスクの討伐してきてくれないかい？
column4:
Are you an Arisen from a foreign land?!
Would you be willing to vanquish the Tarasque for
us?

column3:
引き受けてくれるなら
タラスクの居場所を知ってる子に話を通すから
あたしに話しかけておくれ
column4:
If you're willing to take on the task, I'll have
a conversation with the child who knows the
whereabouts of the Tarasque.
Please speak to me.

column3:
ああ、よく来たね！
あんたがタラスクを退治してくれたおかげで
地鳴りも聞こえなくなったよ！
column4:
Ah, you've come! Thanks to you for defeating the
Tarasque, we can no longer hear the rumbling of
the land!

column3:
最近色んなことが起こるから
うちの戦士たちも疲れててさ――
あんたに助けてもらえて、本当に感謝してるよ
column4:
Lately, so many things have been happening, and
my soldiers are tired... I really appreciate your
help.

column3:
武勇の恩には報いるのが
このダナのならわしだよ！
支援品を格上げしておいたから
またいつでもダナに顔見せにきとくれ！
column4:
It is our custom to repay the debt of bravery.
I have upgraded the support goods for you.
So please feel free to come and show your face in
Dana anytime!

column3:
また困ったことが起きたよ――
こんなに問題が起きるなんて
一体フィンダムはどうしちまったのかね
column4:
Another problem has occurred -
I never thought so many issues would arise.
What on earth happened to Phindym?

column3:
実は、また地鳴りがするようになったんだ
あんたにタラスクを退治してもらったはずなのに
おかしいだろ？
column4:
Actually, the ground is shaking again.
We asked you to defeat the Tarasque, didn't we?
Something's not right.

column3:
あの地鳴り――タラスクのものじゃなかったのかねぇ
もうあたしらには見当もつかないよ
column4:
That shaking ground... it wasn't caused by the
Tarasque, was it?
We have no idea anymore.

column3:
――このファーラナ平原のはずれ
《<SPOT 904>》に、異文化を持った村があるんだ
そこの住人なら何かを知っているかも――
column4:
At the outskirts of the Farana Plain, there's a
village known as <SPOT 904>, inhabited by people
of a different culture.
Those villagers might know something...

column3:
でも、あそこの住人、どうもダナの人間が
嫌いみたいで交流が難しいんだよねぇ――
column4:
But it seems like the people living there really
don't like the residents of Dana, so it's
difficult to interact with them.

column3:
ねぇ、もしよかったらあんたが探りを
入れてきてくれないかい？
通りかかったらでいいからさ
column4:
Hey, if you don't mind, could you do some probing
for me?
If you happen to pass by, that would be great.

column3:
ああ――そういえば、あんた
《マヌンの集落》に顔出してくれたんだろ？
column4:
Ah, by the way, didn't you show up in Manun
Village?

column3:
あそこの長老のエナン――とか
いう人から手紙が届いたんだ
column4:
I received a letter from the elder of that place,
Henin.

column3:
なんでも
「信頼に値する相手だと証明してくれ」
「そのために《<SPOT 901>》
　の魔物を倒してくれ」ってことらしいよ
column4:
It seems they want you to 'prove yourself as a
trustworthy ally.'
You can do that by 'defeating the monsters in
<SPOT 901>,' according to the villagers.

column3:
要するに、武勇を見せろってことさ――
マヌンの住人たちって、もしかしたら
あたしらと似た文化を持ってるのかもね
column4:
In short, they're telling us to show our bravery,
you know? The residents of Manun might actually
have a similar culture to ours.

column3:
まぁ、とにかくそういうことなんだ
彼らに"信頼に値する相手"だって証明するため
魔物退治に行ってくれる気になったら
また声かけておくれよ
column4:
Well, anyway, that's how it is.
In order to prove that we are "trustworthy
allies" to them, if you ever feel like going on a
monster extermination, please let us know again.

column3:
そうそう、あんたが
《マヌンの集落》のエナン爺さんに
聞いてきてくれた《知恵の小塔》なんだけどさ
column4:
Oh, that's right. You brought me info about the
Small Tower of Wisdom that you asked Henin from
Manun Village about, didn't you?

column3:
なんでも、あそこに収められた昔の本に
今度こそ手がかりがあるかもっていうから
封鎖を解くことにしたんだ
column4:
Because there might be a clue in the old books
stored there, we decided to lift the blockade this
time.

column3:
今、手の空いてる子たちに
本を漁らせてるところさ
column4:
Now, I'm letting the children who have free hands
search for books.

column3:
古臭い本以外にも色々ありそうだから
あんたも入りたかったら入っていいよ
何か見つけたら、好きに持って帰りな
column4:
Besides old-fashioned books, there seem to be
various other things here.
If you want to join, you're welcome to.
If you find something you like, feel free to take
it home.

column3:
まぁ、わかってるとは思うけど
本の持ち出しは禁止させてもらうけどね
column4:
Well, I think you understand, but I have to
prohibit taking books out.

column3:
ああ！
何だってあんたはいつも
村が危ないって時に来てくれるんだろうね？
column4:
Ah!
Why is it that you always come when the village
is in danger, I wonder?

column3:
実は今、大変なのさ
タラスクみたいな巨大な動くものを
見たって報告があってね――
column4:
Actually, right now things are tough.
There have been reports of a gigantic moving
creature, like a Tarasque.

column3:
最悪、すぐにでも村ごと別の場所へ
移動しなけりゃ踏み潰されちまうかもしれない
そうなったら、あんたにも
手を貸してもらうかも――
column4:
At worst, we may need to move the entire village
to a different location immediately, or else we
might be crushed.
If that happens, I may ask for your help as
well...

column3:
とにかく今は情報を集めることで
手一杯なんだ
何か用があるなら、改めて話しかけてもらえるかい
column4:
Right now, I'm really busy gathering information.
If you have something to discuss, could you
please talk to me again later?

column3:
あんたのお陰で地鳴りも止んで
平和な生活が戻ってきたよ
ずいぶん世話になったね！
column4:
Thanks to you, even the earthquakes have stopped,
and peace has returned to our lives.
We are truly grateful for all your help!

column3:
まだまだ侵食魔はウロウロしちゃいるけど
ダナは戦士の村だ
そこら辺にいる侵食魔くらい、痛くもかゆくもないさ
column4:
The corrupting monsters are still lurking around,
but Dana is a warrior's village.
The infected around here are nothing to be
worried about.

column3:
侵食と地鳴り――
二つの厄介ごとを抱えてたこの村に
手を貸してくれてありがとう
column4:
Corruption and Earthquakes -
Thank you for lending a hand to this village
burdened with two troubles.

column3:
これほど力を貸してもらったんだ
エリアマスターとして
それからダナの族長ピサルの女房として
あんたには十分なお礼をしなきゃならない
column4:
I've received so much help.
As an Area Master, and also as the wife of
Pisarr, the chief of Dana, I must express my
gratitude to you properly.

column3:
とりあえず、あんたへの支給品に
より一層良いものを揃えるってことは
決まってるんだけど――
column4:
For now, it has been decided to gather even
better supplies for you, but...

column3:
それ以外に、どんなお礼をしようか
迷ってるところなんだよ
何せ、この恩を返せるようなお礼なんて
中々思い浮かばないもんだからさ！
column4:
Apart from that, I'm at a loss as to what kind of
gratitude I should express.
After all, it's not easy to come up with a way to
repay this favor!

column3:
まぁ、これからもダナには寄るんだろ？
勇敢な戦士として、いつでも迎えるからさ
お礼についても追々考えていくことにしようか――
column4:
Well, I guess I'll continue relying on Dana from
now on, right?
As a brave soldier, I'll always be there to
welcome you.
Let's think about the expression of gratitude
little by little as well.

column3:
あんた、覚者ってなら竜のために戦うんだろ？
エモノは一体何なんだい？
大剣？　それとも弓？
column4:
Hey, if you're an Arisen, then you fight for the
dragons, right?
So what exactly are those?
Are they like greatswords or bows?

column3:
もしもあんたがそこそこ槍を使えるようなら――
いつか、精霊槍の達人に紹介してやってもいいよ
レスタニアには精霊槍を扱う戦士は
いなさそうだからね
column4:
If you're reasonably skilled with a spear, then
someday I could introduce you to a master of the
Spirit Lance.
There don't seem to be any soldiers in Lestania
who handle Spirit Lances, you see.

column3:
戦士に休息の場を提供するのがわしの仕事だ
宿の手配から弱化回復まで、何でも言ってくれ
column4:
It is my job to provide a place of rest for
warriors.
From arranging accommodations to weakening
recovery, tell me anything you need.

column3:
勇猛な戦士にも休息は必要だ
必要な時に必要なだけ休まねばならん
column4:
Even a brave warrior needs rest.
You must rest as much as necessary, when
necessary.

column3:
寝床を使うなら<VAL PRICE_INN>貰うことになるが
いいか？
column4:
If you use the bed, you will have to pay <VAL
PRICE_INN> gold, but are you okay with that?

column3: はい
column4: OK

column3: いいえ
column4: Cancel

column3:
見ての通り、今は空いている
よし、好きな寝床を使うといい！
column4:
As you can see, it is currently vacant.
Alright, you should use whichever sleeping spot
you like!

column3: はい
column4: OK

column3: いいえ
column4: Cancel

column3:
戦って、一時の休息を楽しむ――
そしてまた戦いに出る！
どうだ、これこそ戦士として理想の生活だろう
column4:
Fight, and enjoy a momentary rest--
And then, go forth to battle again!
How is it? This is surely the ideal life as a
Soldier, isn't it?

column3:
《弱化の治療》なら
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>必要だが――
column4:
If it's "Treat Weakness", it's <VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
What do you want to do?

column3: はい
column4: OK

column3: いいえ
column4: Cancel

column3:
ハッハッハ！
弱化にはなっていないようだ
弱気にはなっているようだがな
column4:
Hahaha!
You don't seem to have weakened.
You seem to have become more timid, though.

column3:
わしも今は引退してのんびりしているが
鍛練は怠っていないぞ
column4:
I am also currently retired and enjoying a
leisurely life, but I have not neglected my
training.

column3:
――まずは身の証を立ててから
来るべきじゃないのか？
column4:
First, shouldn't we establish our credibility
before we come?

column3:
身の証を立てる前に
休息を取りたいというなら
そりゃ、かまわんが――
column4:
Before proving your innocence, if you wish to
take some rest,
Well then, it's fine...

column3:
ハーイ、色々揃えてるわよ
どうぞ見て行ってね
column4:
Yes, I have various things.
Please feel free to take a look!

column3:
ピサルとラザネイル、素敵でしょ？
ああいう夫婦が理想なのよね
column4:
Pisarr and Razanailt, aren't they wonderful?
That's the ideal kind of couple.

column3:
たくさん覚者がいたら
一人一人が受けられる竜力が少なくならない？
何人もの覚者より、強い覚者が一人いた方が
安心できると思うんだけど
column4:
If there were many Arisen, wouldn't the Dragon
Force that each one can receive be diminished?
I think it would be more reassuring to have one
strong Arisen than a number of Arisen.

column3: あれ？　何も買っていかないの？
column4: Huh? You're not buying anything?

column3:
あ――もしかして、騒ぎになってた
異国の覚者さん？
column4:
Oh, are you the Arisen from the foreign land that
caused all the commotion?

column3:
――まずは身の証を立ててから
買い物しに来てくれるとうれしいわ
ちょっと信用できないもの
column4:
--First, I would be happy if you could prove your
identity before shopping. I can't trust you that
easily.

column3:
や、やぁ――
クレストのことかな？
column4: Ah, um... Is it about Crests?

column3:
クレストっていうのは、装備に付けられる
特殊な力の結晶らしいよ
僕は管理を任されてるだけなんだけど――
column4:
Crests are apparently crystals that can be
attached to equipment, possessing special powers.
I'm just in charge of managing them...

column3:
僕は子供の頃から線が細くて
戦いでも狩りでも中々手柄を上げられなくて――
column4:
Since I was a child, I have always been frail,
unable to achieve any remarkable feats in battles
or hunts...

column3:
なんて、よそから来た人には
この気持ち、わからないよな
column4:
Oh, someone who comes from elsewhere would never
understand this feeling.

column3:
戦いよりもこういうことの方が向いてるだろうって
ピサルからこの仕事を任されたんだ
自分でもそう思うよ
column4:
I was entrusted with this job by Pisarr, who
believed that I was more suited for something like
this than for battle.
I think so too.

column3:
――だけど、イーヴィの好みは
"誰よりも強い男"なんだよなぁ
column4:
But Evey's preference is for a 'man stronger than
anyone else,' you know.

column3:
あの――
身の証を立ててから来てもらえないかな
こういうのって信用が大事だからさ
column4:
You know, it would be great if you could come
after proving yourself.
Because trust is important in situations like
this.

column3:
戦いに行くの？
パーティの編成なら私がお手伝いするわ！
column4:
Are you going to the battle?
If you need help with party formation, I can
assist you!

column3:
力強く、信頼できる仲間と集まることで
一人ひとりの戦士の働きもよくなるはずよ！
column4:
By gathering together strong and reliable
comrades, the efforts of each individual soldier
should also improve!

column3:
ポーンを呼ぶこともできるけど――
どうする？
column4:
You can also call for Pawns.
What will you do?

column3:
変わった衣装――
それがあなたたちの力を引き出す衣なのね
ううん、見慣れないだけで――素敵よ
column4:
Unusual costumes...
Those clothes bring out your power, don't they?
No, it's just because they're unfamiliar...
They're wonderful.

column3:
あっ――
えっと、異国の方――
身の証を立ててもいない怪しい人と喋ってたら
族長に怒られちゃうから――
column4:
Ah—
Um, traveler from a foreign land—
Talking to a suspicious person like me, who
hasn't even proven their identity might anger the
clan chief—

column3: ――何だ
column4: ...What is it?

column3:
この村を纏めているのは
壮健で誇り高き族長、ピサルだ
column4:
The one who leads this village is the robust and
proud chieftain, Pisarr.

column3: 異国の覚者、か――
column4: The Arisen from a foreign land, eh――

column3:
ほう、なるほど
中々鋭い目をしている
column4: Oh, I see. You have quite sharp eyes.

column3: まずは身の証を立てるんだな
column4: First, prove yourself.

column3: おっ、何か用かよ？
column4: Oh, do you need something?

column3:
武器の手入れはいつでも万全だ！
早いとこ戦いに出て手柄を立てたいぜ
column4:
I always ensure that my weapons are in perfect
condition!
I can't wait to go into battle and earn some
credit!

column3:
俺だってダナの戦士
狩りでもいい働きをしているはずだ！
column4:
I, too, am a soldier of Dana.
I should be able to contribute to the hunt!

column3:
族長が狩りに行く時にでも
同行させてもらえりゃ早いんだけどな――
中々アピールするタイミングが――
column4:
If I could just accompany the chief when they go
hunting, we could expedite things, you know――
It's just difficult to find the right timing to
make my appeal――

column3:
盾も剣も、毎日点検しては磨いてるんだぜ
もちろん鍛錬も欠かさねぇ！
column4:
I inspect and polish my shield and sword every
day, and of course, I never neglect my training!

column3:
てめぇ、まずは身の証を立ててからにしろよな
この村で怪しげなことしたら承知しねぇぞ
column4:
First, prove yourself before you speak.
I won't tolerate any suspicious activities in
this village.

column3: 私に用か？
column4: You wanted to see me?

column3:
村に外敵が侵入しないように
ここで見張っているのだ
column4:
I'm here to watch over this place and to ensure
no enemies invade the village.

column3:
ダナはフィンダムでも知られた勇猛な部族の村だが
子供や年寄り、戦いの苦手な者もいる
彼らを守ってこその部族だ
column4:
Dana is a village known all over Phindym for its
brave and fierce tribe, but it also has children,
elders, and those who are not skilled in combat.
Protecting them is what makes our tribe strong.

column3:
ずっと見張りをしていて疲れないのか、だと？
この程度どうということはない
column4:
Do you mean that you never get tired from keeping
watch? It's nothing to be concerned about.

column3:
私に構ってないで村に入ったらどうだ
大方、ピサルかラザネイルに会いに来たのだろう？
column4:
Why don't you enter the village instead of
ignoring me?
Most likely, you've come to meet Pisarr or
Razanailt, haven't you?

column3: すまないが、まずは身の証を立てるのが先だろう
column4:
I'm sorry, but first you should prove your
identity.

column3: はいはい、何の御用？
column4: Yes, yes. What can I help you with?

column3:
うちも育ち盛りの子が多いからね
山のように用意した食事が
あっという間に無くなるのは見てて気分いいもんさ
column4:
We also have many children who are in their
growing years, you know.
It's satisfying to see the meals we prepared like
a mountain disappear in no time.

column3:
アンタも覚者だったら戦いに出ること、あるんだろ？
この村でしっかり食べて、体を休めて
次の旅立ちに備えるんだよ
column4:
If you are also an Arisen, there must be
something you fight for, right?
Eat well and rest your body in this village, and
prepare yourself for the next journey.

column3:
ふぅ、洗濯物は済んだし
次は家畜の世話でもしに行こうかな
column4:
Phew, the laundry is done.
Now, should I go take care of the livestock?

column3:
あっ――
あんた、さっき表で騒いでた奴らの仲間だね？
column4:
Ah... Are you one of the people who were causing
a ruckus outside earlier?

column3:
本当に覚者だっていうんなら
さっさと身の証を立ててきちまいなよ
そしたらややこしいことも無くなるんだからさ
column4:
If you really claim to be an Arisen, then quickly
prove yourself and settle it.
That way, there won't be any more complications.

column3:
《武霊の庵》のそばにある物見台はサイコーなんだ！
フィンダム全体が見渡せるし
"芯なる樹"がすっごくキレイに見えるよ
column4:
The observation deck next to the Spirit Arts Hut
is awesome!
You can oversee the entire Phindym, and the Core
Tree looks incredibly beautiful.

column3: 何だよ？　ここはオレの場所だかんな！
column4: What's going on? This is my spot, you know!

column3:
ここからは村の中くらいなら見渡せるよ
でも、やっぱり村の外を眺めたいなぁ――
column4:
From here, you can see around the middle of the
village.
But, I still want to gaze at the outside of the
village...

column3:
村の入り口はワイニが守ってる
万が一魔物が村に入ってきたって
ダナは戦士の村だからへっちゃらだ！
column4:
The village entrance is guarded by Wine.
Even if monsters somehow get into the village,
it's no big deal because Dana is a warrior's
village!

column3:
一人前の戦士になったら
ワイニみたいに武器を持って村を守りたいんだ
column4:
Once I become a skilled warrior, I want to
protect the village like Wine does, wielding a
weapon.

column3: ――怪しい人とはあんまり喋っちゃダメなんだ
column4:
- You shouldn't talk too much with suspicious
people.

column3: なによ
column4: What is it?

column3:
これからは腕力だけじゃやってけないわ
知識よ、あらゆる状況に対応できる知識が必要なの！
みんなわかってないの！
column4:
From now on, it won't be enough to rely on arm
strength alone.
Knowledge, I need knowledge that can adapt to any
situation!
Everyone just doesn't understand!

column3:
属性がどうとか弱点がなんだとか
そういう知識だけじゃなくて！
もっと幅広い知識を身に付けたいの――
戦いの役に立つはずよ
column4:
It's not just about knowing attributes and
weaknesses.
I want to acquire a broader range of knowledge.
It should be useful in battle.

column3:
暇なの？
ボーッとしてないで、知識を蓄えるなり
身体を鍛えるなりした方がいいんじゃない？
column4:
Are you free?
Instead of spacing out, it would be better to
accumulate knowledge or train your body, wouldn't
it?

column3:
なんなの、怪しい人ね！
信用してほしいんなら、さっさと身の証を
立ててこればいいじゃない！
column4:
What's the matter? You're such a suspicious
person!
If you want me to trust you, then quickly provide
some proof and establish it!

column3: どうした？
column4: Hm, what is it?

column3:
何か面白い話は無いか、だと？
昔話でもすると思ったか
ヌムム――年寄り扱いしおって
column4:
Do you want to hear an interesting story or
something?
Did you think I was going to tell you an old
tale?
Gah, treating me like an old man.

column3:
昔話を聞いて喜ぶ暇があれば
将来のために何ができるかを考えるんだな
column4:
If you have time to rejoice in listening to old
tales, then ponder what you can do for the future.

column3:
ダナの村は戦士の村だ
強くあるからこそ、護るべきものを
支えることができるのだ
column4:
Dana's village is a village of Soldiers.
It is because they are strong that they can
protect what needs to be protected and support it.

column3:
確かに――
俺も、そこのオドランも
すでに戦士としての役からは降りておる――
column4:
Indeed, I and Audran over there have already
retired from our roles as soldiers.

column3:
だが！
だからといって日々の研鑽を怠ることはない
若者に道を譲っただけのこと
column4:
However! I will never neglect my daily training
and pursuit of knowledge.
It's just a matter of giving way to the younger
generation.

column3:
お前は今、別のミッションを進行している
ようだな――
column4:
It seems that you are currently engaged in
another Mission, my lord.

column3:
そのミッションの参加を取りやめてから
あらためてここに来るんだな
column4:
After canceling your participation in that
mission, you have come here again.

column3:
自分の今の状況を把握することは
戦う者にとって常に重要なことだ
column4:
Understanding one's current situation is always
important for a warrior.

column3:
覚者だと言う割に
身の証も立てられんのか？
そんなことでは信用できんな
column4:
Even though you claim to be an Arisen, can you
not provide any proof of your abilities?
I can't trust someone who can't even do that.

column3:
アンタ――他のミッションを
受けている最中じゃないか
column4:
Are you――in the middle of receiving another
mission?

column3:
そちらを先に片づけるか、エントリーを
中止してからまた来るんだね
column4:
Shall we tidy up that area first, or should we
cancel the entry and come back later?

column3: さ、用件は何？
column4: So, what's the subject?

column3:
――ふぅん
なかなか鍛えてるね
column4: Oh, I see. You're quite well trained.

column3:
大物を狩りに行くなら
レウェラに声をかけて
仲間を集めた方がいいよ
column4:
If you're going to hunt a big game, it's better
to ask Lewela for help and gather your comrades.
